review: I don't like the remote.  However, I was able to easily program my main t.v. remote to control this device.It was easy to setup, like most Apple products.  There are no buttons on it, but it has a number of good input/output options on the back.  I'm using HDMI straight to the t.v.Once you're logged into your Apple account, you can see a menu of Netflix, Hulu, and other things.  I like to keep one computer on the home and logged into my iTunes account.  The "home sharing" option has to be on, but then you can stream photos, music, etc... from your computer.There's a lot of features and much more that you can do with this, but I haven't messed around with all the features just yet. So far, I like it.One thing I want to try is traveling with this.  There are some blogs about how to set it up in a hotel, but it seems cumbersome.  I have a hot spot through Verizon and might set it up with that when I'm traveling.  It might work well in a conference to stream things to a projector.

review: This was purchased as a Christmas gift for my geeky dad - the type who knows the specs of what he wants, so it's hard to get him anything tech related. He's loving it! He has it synced up with his iPad and iPhone, and loves that he can change the music we're listening to during dinner from the table. It's not a must have device, but if you know a gadget person who is already into the Apple tech, it's a great gift.
